name: gmlRandomiser
short_description:
Example usage, clusterRandomizer.exe -i TestData.bio.csv.gml -n 10 -m 9 -r 1001
Options: 
  -i <FileName> (gml format (igraph), not yEd gml).
  -n no_of_nodes. 
  -e no_of_edges. 
  -r no_of_randomizations (dafault 1000). 
  -c category to consider, parsed by a dot(.) (dafault 0, i.e., the node label itself). 
  -d consider duel category. 
  -s Show unique categories. 
  -t category to concat (default none), for concatenating all put -1. 
  -f reads automatically edge and node information from "<filename>.count.txt" file. 
  -h help, show this message.
root@ahmed-desktop:~/work8/gmlRandomiser2#
summary: A C++ tool to randomise GML format files.
